message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.DC 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on defending against DoS attacks in Wireless Sensor Networks (WSN) using a Software-Defined Networking (SDN) based protocol. This falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - The paper deals with security threats in WSNs and proposes a countermeasure against DoS attacks. This falls under the scope of cryptography and security. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a protocol that uses SDN to control the flow of packets in WSNs. This falls under the scope of systems and control. 
4. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses the loss rates of packets and how they can be used to drop attacking flows. This falls under the scope of information theory. 
5. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper proposes a protocol that can be incrementally deployed in WSNs. This falls under the scope of distributed, parallel, and cluster computing.
